title: Enhancing Transferability of Adversarial Examples with Spatial Momentum. (arXiv:2203.13479v2 [cs.CV] UPDATED)
description: Many adversarial attack methods achieve satisfactory attack success rates under the white-box setting, but they usually show poor transferability when attacking other DNN models. Momentum-based attack is one effective method to improve transferability. It integrates the momentum term into the iterative process, which can stabilize the update directions by adding the gradients' temporal correlation for each pixel. We argue that only this temporal momentum is not enough, the gradients from the spatial domain within an image, i.e. gradients from the context pixels centered on the target pixel are also important to the stabilization. For that, we propose a novel method named Spatial Momentum Iterative FGSM attack (SMI-FGSM), which introduces the mechanism of momentum accumulation from temporal domain to spatial domain by considering the context information from different regions within the image. SMI-FGSM is then integrated with temporal momentum to simultaneously stabilize the gradients' update direction from both the temporal and spatial domains. Extensive experiments show that our method indeed further enhances adversarial transferability. It achieves the best transferability success rate for multiple mainstream undefended and defended models, which outperforms the state-of-the-art attack methods by a large margin of 10\% on average.
dc:creator: Guoqiu Wang, Huanqian Yan, Xingxing Wei
